title: Why you don't truth serum an Addams
archive_warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
summary:
Bianca gets Yoko and Xavier to pour a potion in Wednesday's tea that enhances her emotions. She's not that different actually, well except around Enid.

Enid wants answers, Thing wants to live and Wednesday doesn't really know where she is if she's honest.

Day 2 comes and goes, and Enid think she might be gay.

Wednesday lays in her bed and plots.

It's almost time for her perfect confession but there's still a lot to do.

Fucking finally

The end.

text:
“The 4-leaf clover in the potion adds a bit of fae magic to the concoction, this of course makes the effects of the potion harder to reverse. The clover can also be used to terminate the effects of the potion if made into tea on the full moon.”


 


The teacher’s monotone voice faded into the background eventually only becoming a steady ringing in her ears. She looked over at the clock hoping that there would only be a few minutes left but it mockingly read 11:15. There was an hour and 15 minutes till lunch. Bored out of her mind Bianca looked around the class.

 

To her left Ajax was dowsing off, she would keep him awake with a hard kick every few minutes making the snakes under his hat hiss. To the table on her right, Xavier and Yoko seemed to be having a thumb war under the table. Finally at the Table in front of her Wednesday Addams, the school’s savior last year seemed to be the only person who could take the torture of their potion’s teacher’s monotone voice. To Wednesday's left Enid had fallen asleep but was luckily covered by Greg, the half-giant transfer student from Germany.  

 

“Now you’re probably wondering exactly what this potion does. This particular elixir is completely harmless if used in small doses, it enhances the emotions of the person who consumes it.” 


In Bianca’s haze of boredom, she only had one clear thought: 

What if Wednesday drank it? 

 The girl had proven time and time again to be cold but there were these moments when something would shine through. Whether she was defending Eugene from bullies, picking up a pencil Xavier dropped, or comforting Enid during their group's scary movie night, all be it in her own way by saying “There, there” over and over, that showed that she was capable of 
something
. 


She had to see this. 

 

Quickly she passed a note to Xavier “Did you write down the ingredients?” 


A note was thrown back at her almost immediately “Yes, why? You should really pay more attention. I can't keep doing your notes.”


Bianca rolled her eyes and wrote back, 
“That’s not what I need them for! I want to have Wednesday try the potion.” 


After giving Xavier the note, she saw his eyes go wide. He looked at her like she had gone crazy.


His next note simply read “Fuck no.”


Another longer note followed “Sorry ran out of paper, why don’t we text instead? We’re not in the ’90s.”


Bianca tilted her head at the audacity but sneakily pulled out her phone. 





B: Just imagine what she would be like with actual expressions!

 

X: Imagine what we would be like if we made it to 35.

 

B: Pls Xavier! Just think, what if she’s had a secret crush on you all along but didn't know how to express it?

 

She knew she was a bitch for using her ex’s not-so-secret crush on the goth against him, but she couldn’t find it in herself to care at the moment. 


  


X: It would be nice to see her actually give a fuck about people for once 

 

X: I’m only in if Yoko is in, we’ll need the super strength when she comes to reap our souls.

 

B: I’ll add her 

 

Y: Fuck no, absolutely not. I’ve lived to 175 by not doing stupid shit like this. 

 

B: Come on Yoko don’t be like that!

 

X: Yeah! What’s the worst she could do to you? You’re a vampire!

 

Y: Garlic overdose, blessed water, poisoned blood, stake through the heart.


Y: there’s a lot of things she could do.

 

B: Dang, I never realized it was so easy to kill a vampire.


B: But we need you! What if I get the rest of the sires to provide some extra protection?

 

Y: Alright but if we all end up dead from this, I want my funeral to be the prettiest!

 

B: Ok this should be pretty easy, Yoko makes the potion because she’s the best at it, I distract Addams during lunch and Xavier pours it in her drink.

 

X: Do I have to pour it in?

 

B: Yes

 

X: IDK dude it feels a bit ya know, gross to be spiking my friend’s drink. Ya know like a guy, putting weird shit in a girl’s drink. 


X: Also, if she sees me do it, I'm the least likely to survive.

 

Y: He has a good point

 

B: Alright, I’ll put the drink in, and Xavier can attempt to distract her with his doodles.


B: Everyone down 


Y: Ye


X: I guess 

 

“ Now class, we will be making our own brew of Cordibus Ignem. First gently mash the marsh grass in a counterclockwise direction.”  

 

Bianca looked over to see Yoko carefully following the instructions. And Xavier made a double batch to turn into the teacher, one vile from him and another from “Yoko”. 

 

By the end of class, they had 3 absolutely useless batches of Cordibus Ignem and one perfect batch. 

 

“Now class please turn your potions into me while exiting the classroom.”


One by one the students lined up and handed their vials to the teacher hearing his feedback as they left. “Terrible, awful, decent, back to awful, ew, disgusting, 3 thumbs down. Ah, a perfect batch misses Addams, Miss Sinclair your is acceptable, Mr. Thorpe terrible, Miss Barclay decent and Miss Tanaka awful. I expected better from you.” 

 

Wednesday and Enid were waiting for them outside the greenhouse, the wolf gave a sad smile to the trio “Don’t worry guys! I’m sure they weren’t that bad, you know how Mr. Spine can be.” 


“Yes even I must admit that Mr. Spine’s grading methods are quite harsh.”


Added Wednesday, the eldest Addams had become a bit softer to her friends after her close call with the Grim Reaper, who according to Wednesday was actually a distant cousin.

 

The group walked to the dining hall for lunch and after finding a table Bianca thought it was the perfect time to put the plan into motion. She cleared her throat loudly “Hey Wednesday, did Xavier show you his new trick? The one with the bird-eating tarantula?”


At the mention of the large arachnid the goth turned towards Xavier “A bird-eating tarantula?”  

 

Before the conversation could go any further Enid spoke up “I’ll be right back guys I need to use the lady’s room!” She gave a quick side hug to Wednesday before leaving “Don’t miss me too much bestie!” 


After waving away the blond the goth turned back to Xavier “Well are you going to make the tarantula or not?”  


The artist quickly pulled out a pen and paper “Of Course yeah! I totally know how to do that.” While the poor man was trying to remember what that specific arachnid looked like; Yoko passed the vial to Bianca who poured it into the eldest Addam’s tea, without measuring out the dose.


After Wednesday quickly realized that Xavier had no idea what a bird-eating tarantula was, she looked over at Bianca “Why did you lie to me?”


Bianca had to think quick 


“X-Xavier you said you could do it!”


The artist looked at his ex-girlfriend in shock, “What?”


“I can’t believe you would lie to me like that! And now I've lied to Wens.”


“Don’t call me that.” 


While the exes were “arguing” Wednesday took a big gulp of her tea. Then set the cup down a bit rougher than usual before saying.


“Could you please stop yelling? You’re being extremely annoying.” 


The whole table turned to the Addams in shock, that was the closest she’d ever been to yelling at anybody. While her voice was still dry it had a bit more bite to it than it normally would. 


The goth’s eyes widened slightly “I’m very sorry I don’t know where that came from.” 


She lets out a small sigh before continuing “I deeply apologize for my immature reaction.”


The first one to snap out of their shock is Yoko “Hey Wednesday, how do you feel about vampires?”


“I respect any form of undead immensely.” 

 

 

That was nowhere as interesting as I thought it would be, 

thought Bianca.


“Why’s everyone looking at Willa like that?” Before anyone knew what was happening Wednesday had practically jumped out of her chair and made her way toward Enid.


The young Addams dropped to one knee and took Enid's hand into her own “Cara mia, love of my life the only light I tolerate in this horrid place thank you for returning to my side.”  Wednesday began leaving soft kisses on Enid's hands and wrists only pausing to look up at her. “What can I do for you, my sunlight?” 

 

The entire group was left frozen again. Hell, the entire courtyard froze. Some people say that hell itself froze over that day. 


 No one wanted to move, hell some people were too scared to even breathe which resulted in at least 2 of the fangs and a siren passing out. Bianca was trying to hold back a smile though. This was exactly what she wanted! To prove that the goth had emotions, they had just been buried deep, deep, deep down it seems. And was this what she expected? Fuck no. There’s no way anyone could have expected this. 

 

Poor Enid’s face was bright red and she was struggling to stutter out any words. Wednesday was still on one knee in front of her and was still placing soft kisses on her hands. 


Poor Xavier looked like someone had run over his puppy on Christmas morning, Yoko was hiding a smirk and Ajax was so high Bianca doubted he knew where he was.

 

Then Enid’s eyes flashed a bright yellow, “What happened to Willa? I was gone for 2 minutes!”   


The werewolf bent down and took Wednesday's face into her hands “Willa are you alright? You feel warm, Willa you’re never warm!” 


Wednesday only seemed to register bits of Enid’s distress. She gently put her own hands over Enid’s and started whispering “Mi amor, are you alright? What’s wrong? How can I fix it and put your beautiful smile back on your face?” Wednesday slowly turned towards the table where their friends were sitting. “Are they causing you distress, my love? Would you like me to take care of them?” The goth's hand started moving toward one of her many hidden weapons.

 

“No! No, no, let's not do that.” Enid quickly grabbed Wednesday’s hand again. 


The blond looks over at her friend group “One of you better tell me what you did to my best friend right fucking now or I’ll start ripping off heads!” 


Everybody could practically hear the goth swoon at that. 

 

Bianca was the first person to stand up “Alright we’ll tell you, but we should probably go somewhere a lot more private.” 

 

That’s when Enid realized that everybody was staring at her and Wednesday.


“Alright we can go to our dorm, but I want answers the second we get there.” 

 

Getting Wednesday to their dorm proved to be very difficult, the young goth didn’t want to tear her eyes away from the werewolf even for one second, which resulted in her stepping on the feet, tails and tentacles of many of her classmates.


Eventually they did make it to the dorm room.

 

The door slamming open woke Thing up from his afternoon nap, he jumped up looking towards the group of 6 that just stumbled in. He very quickly noticed that Wednesday was not alright. How did he know? Well, that was very simple. He was her lifelong companion and best friend, also she had her arm hooked with Enid and wasn’t looking away from her. Like at all, it was very unsettling, Wednesday wasn’t someone to blink often but even he’d never seen her stair at something that long. 

 

He started frantically tapping on the desk trying to get Wednesday’s or Enid’s attention. Sadly, he only got the attention of the high gorgon boy “Enid your little hand dude is going crazy.” 

 

“Little hand dude” he says, nothing about Thing was little! He was in fact a very large hand! 


And this very large hand was very concerned for his sister. 


Thing started tapping louder 

ENID WHAT’S WRONG WITH WEDNESDAY?




 

The blond turned to face him “I don’t know that's what these 4 were about to tell me.” 


The blond and the disembodied hand turned towards the group, Wednesday had hazily started playing with Enid’s hair keeping her entertained for the time being. 


After a few seconds of nobody talking Bianca once again knew she would have to- 

 

“I didn’t have anything to do with this Enid. I was just trying to sleep in class, but she kept kicking me! And then she was like hey Xavier what if we gave Wednesday the potion we made and like put it in her tea and he and Yoko were totally like down for it. They didn’t even ask me if I wanted to so I’m kinda offended but I would have said no cuz like I wanna live to be at least 21 ya know?”

 

After processing the word vomit that came out of Ajax’s mouth Enid was able to connect the dots. “You guys' drugged Wednesday? With a potion that heightens emotions. But how? All of your potions were terrible.” 

 

Yoko cleared her throat a bit before speaking “I made the batch we used on Wednesday, Xavier made 2 to turn in and Bianca just didn’t give a shit, I guess. But we didn’t expect it to turn out like this really! We just thought she’d be like nicer or something and Xavier just wanted to know if she was like secretly in love with him or not. I think that answer’s pretty clear now.”    

 

Thing couldn’t believe his non-ears; Wednesday had somehow been drugged by the 3 stooges. She’d found people to let her guard down around and they spiked her drink and turned her into- into Gomez! Oh, dear Satan Gomez and Morticia were going to kill him. 


Thing started visibly trembling thinking about everything the heads of the Addams family would do to him. They’d probably leave him in a dark cupboard until he lost his tan and his skin dried out, they rip off his fingers and sew them on backwards, they’d roll him and bacon and give him to Pubert! 

 

Wednesday for the first time took her gaze off of Enid and looked at Thing, she bent down and picked him up “Thing what is wrong my friend? There’s no need to be afraid no harm will come to you right now you’ve done nothing wrong.” The goth spoke comfortingly, which in all honesty nobody in the room knew she could do. 

 

While it should have made Thing feel better it only made him feel worse Wednesday was clearly dazed, he didn’t know how much of the conversation she actually heard and registered. Whatever drug they gave her was strong enough to keep her from focusing on multiple things at once.  He crawled up Wednesday’s arm and to her shoulder where he did the closest thing he could to crying. 

 

Enid was at a loss; she knew the potion they used shouldn’t have had this effect. The professor had said it was harmless in… small doses. “How much did you give her?” 

 

The group looked at Bianca “I just poured in what Yoko gave me.”


Yoko’s eyebrows shot up “You weren't supposed to put the whole thing in!”


“Why didn’t you say that then?”


“It was on the bottle!” 


“Okay everyone shut up unless I’m talking to you.” said Enid 


“Yoko, how long is this supposed to last?” 


“Well, it should have lasted like less than a day but with how much Bianca poured in it’ll probably be more like 2 or 3 days.”


The blond ran her hands through her hair and sighed heavily “Okay so we just have to last the weekend.”


She turned to face the goth who was still attempting to comfort Thing. “Just 3 days, we can last 3 days.” 


They couldn’t last 3 days, they couldn’t even last 2. It was halfway through the first day when Enid started thinking they were waaaay in over their heads. Dealing with Wednesday was difficult enough normally, but everyone eventually learned to keep their hands to themselves and not to be overly offended by her sarcasm and dry humor. Wednesday was a very violent person if you didn’t understand her boundaries, but she had enough self-control to hold herself back. 


That was long gone now. 


Suddenly every accidental shoulder brush in the hallway resulted in a dagger to the throat, any eye contact that lasted too long ended in a headlock if you were lucky and a saw trap if you weren’t. The worst part of it all was Wednesday’s reactions to anything she considered offensive towards Enid. 

 

Xavier makes a joke at her expense. Suddenly he’s covered in a rash from head to toe and his bed is covered in poison sumac leaves. Ajax touches Enid’s hand by accident while handing her a sheet of paper. Suddenly his snakes are covered in fig sap and convulsing. 


And it’s not just their friends either, Hannah from geometry class accidentally tripped Enid and they still haven’t found her body, Kyle from hexes 101 sneezed too close to Enid and found himself in a shallow grave with only his head sticking out. 


And it had only been a day and a half!

 

The entire school knew there was something with Wednesday but were too afraid to mention it to any of the staff. 

 

Enid really shouldn’t have been flattered by any of this, in fact she should have been horrified! But there was something about knowing that somebody was so in love with you that they’d torture for you, and in Wednesday’s case to 

not

 kill for you. The werewolf knew that Wednesday was very deadly and had no qualms about murder. So, the fact that she held herself back for Enid…...


It made a part of her, the very not human part of her howl in joy.

 

But Enid wasn’t like gay or anything. Not that there’s anything wrong with that! She would just have to let Wednesday down after the potion had worn off. 


But until then there was nothing wrong with her enjoying any of Wednesday’s soft words or reveling in the fact that she was now the only person that Wednesday would actually hug. 


The first time she did it after their first period together Enid's heart jumped out of her chest. 


Of course, Wednesday only did it to establish some sort of claim on her in front of the class but it was still sweet! 

 

Right now, they were at lunch, Wednesday was pressed up against Enid on one half of the table and everyone else was squished together on the other half. Thing started joining them at lunch after the whole spiking incident and stayed at the head of the table.


“Cariño, are you alright? You haven't touched any of your food. Would you like me to feed you?” 


Enid let out a small sigh “No that’s alright Willa I’m just waiting for it to cool down.”


Wednesday let out a disappointed sigh before pushing some of her food around in her own plate “Of course mi amor, my apologies.” 

 

From the other side of the table Yoko let out a loud groan “Damn it Enid just let her feed you the soup!”


Everyone else yelled in agreement.


“Just let her Enid!”


“Eat the soup bro!”


“Enid please I can’t watch this anymore!”


“Oh my God, fine! Wednesday you can feed me.” 


The goth looked up at Enid with a small smile and reached out to hold Enid’s left hand “Gracias mi vida, thank you for letting my filthy skin touch your pure hands. I am not deserving of the honor to be seated by you, thank you for letting me earn my place at your side by being of use to you.” 


Wednesday started using her other hand to feed Enid her soup while the hand holding Enid’s started rubbing small circles on the back of Enid’s with her thumb.


In all honesty Enid was eating on autopilot, she only felt her mouth opening and closing but all she could think about was how beautiful Wednesday's eyes looked when the sun was hitting them at just the right angle. Wednesday’s eyes were like a void, they were deprived of light. But when the light hit them just right Enid could see flecks of gold and hazel in their darkness. Like gemstones glowing in a mine.  

 

While Enid and Wednesday were having their moment, everyone else was growing increasingly uncomfortable. Well, everyone except for Yoko who was just glad her best friend was finding her way out of the closet. 

 

Surprisingly it was Ajax who finally had the balls to say something “Hey guys I’m like super sorry to interrupt but like class starts in 5 minutes.” 

 

Potions class went by quickly and uneventfully, Wednesday was able to pay attention in small spurts writing down something the teacher said before going back to looking at Enid and repeating the whole process again. 

 

Mr. Spine obviously knew what was happening. He wasn’t the potion teacher for nothing! “Enid, Wednesday, Xavier, Yoko and Bianca. I need to see you all after class.”

 

After class Mr. Spine sat at his desk and stared at his student expectedly “So, which one of you is going to tell me who gave Miss Addams Cordibus Ignem? And how did you mess it up enough for it to have this effect?”    

 

Enid quickly launched into an explanation “It was those three I had nothing to do with, I'm as much of a victim as Wednesday is!”


Mr. Spine let out a loud sigh “This happens every year. You think the school board would stop making this a required potion after the hundredth time but no fuck me, I guess. So, who was the idiot who added the clover?”

 

Everyone looked over to Yoko “Hey I didn’t add any clovers! I followed the potion exactly how it was written in the book.”


Mr. Spine looked at them intensely “Well obviously someone added clover to the potion, and they added too much of it, that is why Miss Addams is acting like a lovesick pup.”

 

“My tea”


The group turned towards Wednesday “The tea they spiked was clover tea.”


The group turned back to Yoko “How was I supposed to know she drinks clover tea? Well, what happens now, teach?”

 

“This complicates things, you can’t just wait the potions effects out like you were probably going to. You’ll have to wait until the full moon to make a tea to reverse the effects, the next one should be next Saturday. Meanwhile I have to contact the Addam’s and inform them of their daughter’s condition.”



For the first time in 2 days everyone was thinking the same thing 

Well fuck 

 


Wednesday was seen as a very complex person, but she wasn’t, not really. She liked her space, her family, poison, the dark, the color black and a few other things most people would consider “morbid” and “disturbing” but there is one thing Wednesday loved. Enid. 


The blonde had all but taken over Wednesday’s mind in a brutal and bloody war against Wednesday’s base instincts. 


First came the first wave, the dreaded K-pop music, Wednesday hated it. She wanted to tear off her own ears whenever she heard it. Yet Enid loved it so eventually Wednesday gave into her pleas and let her play it in their room. She loved to see the blond dance around the room with a wide smile swinging her head around and moving her arms like an electrocuted octopus. It was uncoordinated and against rhythm and reason. It was Enid! 

 

The second wave was the color. Wednesday may have greatly exaggerated her color allergy, but she still hated it anywhere near her. She could make exceptions for white or dark gray, maybe even a very very dark blue. But she’ll never forget how she felt stepping into her room at Nevermore for the first time and seeing that damn window shine its color everywhere. 


Every shadow was overtaken by yellows, blues and pinks. Every dark damp corner gone. It made her want to vomit. 


Her first plan was to remove all the tape from the window entirely after Enid went to sleep and to just pretend the tape was never actually there. If Enid ever asked about it or made any accusations, she would just look at her weird or tell her she was going crazy. Then she saw her roommate’s reaction to just half the tape being removed and decided against it. 


The Snoods were part of it too! Just knowing she was matching with someone wearing 

pink 

was enough to make her want to commit seppuku, ritualistic samurai suicide, to keep her honor.  


But seeing Enid smile every time she put that thing on was enough for her to ignore the feeling of her skin wanting to peel off her body. 

 

Then Enid completely took over Wednesday’s mind with 

the hug

. That hug had cemented Enid into Wednesday’s very short list of people she cared about. But more importantly it activated the Addams family curse. She was in love with Enid and there was nothing anyone could do to stop it. 


She fell fast, she spent the entire summer sending Enid messages on the phone Xavier got her. The entire summer she craved to be near her, one time Lurch had to pin her down to stop her from actually going to her, the poor butler still had the bite marks from the battle. 


She thought that once she returned to Nevermore that she would be able to woo Enid properly just as her father had to her mother, but it proved difficult. 

 

Enid had no understanding of Addams courting traditions. She didn’t understand the “roadkill” as she so kindly put it, that Wednesday brought for her was to show her that she could hunt just as well as any wolf.


She didn’t get that Wednesday almost slaughtered Bianca in a fencing tournament to prove that she would both kill and hold back for Enid.


And she sure as hell didn’t understand that she had given Ajax a lobotomy to prove that no other suitor would stand in her way. Enid was actually very angry at that one. Wednesday had to reverse it…. Which she had, for the most part.

 

For once in her life Wednesday couldn’t think of anything to say or do to properly express her feelings. How could she tell Enid that she would paint Nevermore red with the blood of anybody for her. How could she tell her that she would paint herself pink for her. 

 

And then the perfect opportunity presented itself.


Bianca, Xavier and Yoko really thought that Wednesday wouldn’t see what they were doing. She was almost impressed; she had truly made the right choice in friends. 


She knew what they were up to the second she saw Xavier making a double batch of Cordibus Ignem. Her suspicions were confirmed when Bianca tried to distract her with a 

bird eating tarantula drawing 

of all things. As if Xavier would ever actually research arachnids for absolutely no reason. 


But after she drank it, she was free. Free to express to Enid exactly how much she meant to her without any of her anxieties getting a hold of her, and the clover tea meant that she had as much time as she needed.

 

Until Mr. Spine found out, now she only had until the next full moon, and they had notified her parents who were probably already on their way. She had to find a way to not only make Enid come to terms with her sexuality but also fall in love with her in a week. 


She’d have to step it up. Luckily while she was high on this potion any idea is a good idea. 


But she needed something big. Something that would never be forgotten by anyone who witnessed it. 


And more importantly if it made Enid finally realize that she wasn’t as straight as she thought at least half her job would be done. 


Seriously all of Nevermore knew that Enid was fruitier than a Whole Foods. 


I mean her music taste alone was mostly Twice, Girl in Red, Hozier and Rick Montgomery.

 

Wait 


That’s perfect…. she’s got some things to set up.


She sits up in her bed and turns toward her desk “Thing please get up, we’ve got something to do to impress my future wife.” The hand jumped up and ran from the desk onto Wednesday’s shoulder “How does Enid Addams sound to you? Her name will look beautiful carved next to mine on our family tree. I do hope mother and father like her, I’ll introduce them once they get here.” 

 

Wednesday looks towards her sleeping roommate and smiles “Oh she’s just so gorgeous Thing, I can’t wait for us to be wed.”

 

Thing taps on her shoulder.

 Do you think she’ll want to wear white or pink to the wedding?



Wednesday hums thoughtfully “While I hope that I can convince her to wear black I’m sure she’ll look magnificent in whatever she chooses. Oh, and thing grab my cello I’m going to need it.”

 

Thing taps out 

Bitch I’m a hand how am I supposed to move a whole ass cello?



“Damn alright I’ll grab the cello, but I need you to run to town and grab some sheet music for me while I grab the rest of the things I’ll require for tonight.  

 


Got it 



Everything had to be perfect.


Every flower impeccable, every drop of water purified, and every ray of light controlled. 


Light had a way of doing whatever it wanted but today Wednesday would snuff out the sun if she had to, the light needed to shine in a very certain way today.

 

She had been up since 6 in the morning carving, welding, summoning, blackmailing and preparing for her ultimate declaration of love. 


If she was completely honest with herself, she didn’t know how she would take it if this backfired, especially while she was all drugged up. Her self-restraint was close to none and her craving for homicide was hanging by a thread. 


A bright colorful thread that liked smothering Wednesday in hugs and once suplexed a guy that had cat-called her in town. 

 

Enid truly was perfect for her, but she could daydream about her later. It was time for her to set everything up, luckily for her help had arrived.

 

“Oh, my little rain cloud! Mrs. Weems' reanimated corpse told us you were preparing something in the courtyard.”

 

Wednesday rappelled down from the building she was hanging colorful glass shards from to meet her father and brother on the ground. 

 

“Hello father, Pugsley, I hope your drive here was dreadful. Where is mother?”

 

“Oh, her and the reincarnated corpse of principal Weems are making out.”

 

Wednesday blinked slowly 


“And you’re like ok with that?”


Her father threw his head back and laughed “Of course she’s just refueling the magic inside Weems that keeps her alive.”

 

“By making out with her?”

 

“Well, it was either that or they make raw passionate love in the principal's office, and I don’t think the school board would appreciate that.”


Wednesday turned to look at her brother who was looking into the distance with a traumatized look on his face. 


“And there wasn't any other spell mother could have used?”

 

“Strangely enough no, well there was one, but it required the blood of a North American wyrm and I hunted those to extinction in college so really this is my own fault.” 


Her father looked into the distance for a while before snapping back.
